definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: Despite Spain passing well, they weren’t creating a great amount of chances.
sentences.chinese: 儘管西班牙傳球精妙，他們也沒有製造太多進球機會。

sentences.english: The reciever ran wide to catch the pass.
sentences.chinese: 接球員跑動範圍很寬，以便接到傳球。

sentences.english: He has put over good final balls since the start of the season.
sentences.chinese: 從這季初開始，他漂亮的終結傳球會不斷展現。

sentences.english: You either settle for the outside shot or you pass to your teammates.
sentences.chinese: 他們迫使你選擇傳球或外線投籃。

sentences.english: Even now, he will play catch till his whole shoulder gives out.
sentences.chinese: 現在，他還玩傳球遊戲，而且總要玩到整個肩膀發酸。

sentences.english: It's right to have a high rhythm, a good ball circulation, but always with precision.
sentences.chinese: 有正確的節奏很重要，來回倒腳，精確傳球。

sentences.english: The star halfback hauled down the pass for a touchdown.
sentences.chinese: 那位明星中位接住遠傳球觸地得分。

sentences.english: I thank Camoranesi for the beautiful pass.
sentences.chinese: 我要感謝卡莫拉內西那記漂亮的傳球。

sentences.english: So that the passer knows which way you are going, use a hand signal.
sentences.chinese: 爲了讓傳球者知道你在往哪走，做一個手勢。

sentences.english: From now on just keep passing the ball and play together as a team.
sentences.chinese: 從現在起，就不停地傳球，如整隊那樣一起打球。

sentences.english: Zeroing in on his Passing skills, this boy could very well be a talented talent.
sentences.chinese: 單看傳球技能，這小孩當有希望之星級的潛能。

sentences.english: Hand off first, don't push long passes.
sentences.chinese: 先在後場倒一倒腳，別忙着大腳傳球。

sentences.english: Surface's looking is to scatter ball, in truth is hit toward the Sung clear hero's empress back quondam.
sentences.chinese: 表面看起來是傳球，其實是向宋明傑的後背砸過去的。

sentences.english: Technically, I'm much more fluid in the one-touch game.
sentences.chinese: 在技術上，在一腳傳球的比賽中我變得更加流暢。

sentences.english: Player plays ball with the intention of constructing an attack.
sentences.chinese: 運動員在傳球的主要目的是組織扣球。

definition: (soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
(military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
to deal the fatal blow (sports, chess etc)/to score the winning point
to be at the scene (sitting for an exam, performing, competing, giving directions etc)/firsthand (experience)/impromptu (remarks etc)
